Operation 'post-/crm/v3/objects/companies/batch/update_update' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. data.current_description: Update a batch of companies by ID.
data.description_suggestion: Update multiple companies in a single request by their IDs. Accepts a batch input containing company objects with ID and updated properties. Returns a batch response with status codes indicating success (200) or partial success (207) with individual operation results. Supports partial updates - only provided properties will be modified.
data.reasoning: Current description is too minimal. Added details about input format (batch with IDs), response codes and their meanings, and clarification that partial updates are supported. This helps AI agents understand the operation's mechanics and when to use it.

Enhanced to clarify pagination capability, parameter usage, and response format for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Retrieve all companies, using query parameters to control the information that gets returned.
data.summary_suggestion: List companies with pagination and filtering
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve a paginated list of companies with customizable filtering and property selection. Supports query parameters to control returned properties, limit results, and navigate pages. Returns a paginated response containing company objects and pagination information for retrieving additional results.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about pagination support and return structure. Enhanced to clarify pagination capability, parameter usage, and response format for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/objects/companies/batch/upsert_upsert' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear but description lacks details about operation behavior and response format. Added clarification about how matching works, the create vs. update logic, and response structure including status codes. This helps AI agents understand the upsert semantics and expected outcomes.

data.current_summary: Create or update a batch of companies by unique property values
data.current_description: Create or update companies identified by a unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query parameter. `idProperty` query param refers to a property whose values are unique for the object.
data.description_suggestion: Create or update multiple companies in a single request using a unique property identifier. The `idProperty` query parameter specifies which property contains unique values for matching existing companies. Existing companies matching the property value are updated; non-matching records are created. Returns a batch response with status codes indicating success (200) or partial success (207) with individual operation results.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description lacks details about operation behavior and response format. Added clarification about how matching works, the create vs. update logic, and response structure including status codes. This helps AI agents understand the upsert semantics and expected outcomes.

data.current_description: Search for companies by filtering on properties, searching through associations, and sorting results. Learn more about [CRM search](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/search#make-a-search-request).
data.summary_suggestion: Search companies with filters and sorting
data.description_suggestion: Search for companies using advanced filtering on properties, association-based queries, and result sorting. Accepts a search request object specifying filter criteria, association searches, and sort order. Returns matching company objects with their properties and associations. Supports complex queries combining multiple filter conditions and association traversals.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description mentions capabilities but lacks specificity about input format and response structure. Enhanced to clarify the request object structure, return format, and support for complex queries. This helps AI agents understand the search operation's capabilities and how to construct queries.

message: Operation 'delete-/crm/v3/objects/companies/{companyId}_archive' has semantic quality issues: inconsistent_terminology, missing_side_effects. Summary correctly uses 'Archive' terminology consistent with the operation name and API context. However, description uses 'Delete' which is inconsistent with the summary and operation semantics. Added clarification that this is a soft delete (archival) rather than permanent deletion, and explained the restoration window as a side effect for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Delete a company by ID. Deleted companies can be restored within 90 days of deletion. Learn more about [restoring records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).
data.description_suggestion: Archive a company by ID. Archived companies can be restored within 90 days of archival. This operation performs a soft delete, preserving the company record for potential restoration. Learn more about [restoring records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).
data.reasoning: Summary correctly uses 'Archive' terminology consistent with the operation name and API context. However, description uses 'Delete' which is inconsistent with the summary and operation semantics. Added clarification that this is a soft delete (archival) rather than permanent deletion, and explained the restoration window as a side effect for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Merge two company records. Learn more about [merging records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/merge-records).
data.description_suggestion: Merge two company records into a single record. Requires specifying the primary company ID and the company ID to merge into it via the request body. The secondary company record will be archived, and its associations will be transferred to the primary record. Returns the merged company object. Learn more about [merging records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/merge-records).
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is too vague. Missing critical details about input requirements (which company is primary vs. secondary), side effects (secondary record archival, association transfer), and output (merged record).
